Electoral Commission polling place decisions under fire amidst recount and voting irregularities at Manurewa Marae https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/electoral-commission-polling-place-decisions-under-fire-amid-recount-and-voting-irregularities-at-manurewa-marae/UC6NWC2RVJDALJINAMQWXJL5W4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/electoral-commission-polling-place-decisions-under-fire-amid-recount-and-voting-irregularities-at-manurewa-marae/UC6NWC2RVJDALJINAMQWXJL5W4/ Will TraffordThe issue is part of a larger probe into election conduct at the marae. Thu, 09 Nov 2023 00:50:27 +0000 The Electoral Commission is investigating if it was right to have a polling place at the workplace of the Tāmaki Makaurau Te Pāti Māori candidate, where she is CEO. Photo / Bevan Conley, NZME

Explained: Why this El Niño is behaving differently - and what it means for NZ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/explained-why-this-el-nino-is-behaving-otherly-and-what-it-means-for-nz/HG232RA3RNEZJD5QGFFLEHZPJM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/explained-why-this-el-nino-is-behaving-otherly-and-what-it-means-for-nz/HG232RA3RNEZJD5QGFFLEHZPJM/ Jamie MortonNiwa forecaster says El Niño could peak unusually late - and may linger to next winter. Thu, 09 Nov 2023 00:04:57 +0000 While El Nino has formed - as shown by this map of current ocean temperatures - the western Pacific is still running unusually warm. A forecaster says that could have implications for New Zealand. Image / Niwa
